body:
### Problem

I noticed a flicker where the startup screen was shown for a split second after updating neovim. After running a git bisect, I have narrowed it down to 2b4c1127ad1c8cff38f562d71f411c35ec6ba8d6. There seems to have been a regression in clearing the startup screen for dashboards to take over. Previously nothing of the startup screen was shown, but now that screen is shown for a split second before a dashboard takes over

This seems to only be a problem when extui is enabled as well

# Before bad commit

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8ef9794e-39ed-4817-b40b-3cac7e4b0d83

# After bad commit

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/934a7fe8-f0d2-498c-a16f-6813e35ba61f

### Steps to reproduce

init.lua
```lua
for name, url in pairs({
	startify = "https://github.com/mhinz/vim-startify",
}) do
	local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify(".repro/" .. name, ":p")
	if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
		vim.fn.system({ "git", "clone", "--depth=1", url, install_path })
	end
	vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end
require("vim._extui").enable({})
```

It can also be sort of reproduced with just enabling extui and then setting a colorscheme to something different than the default one like this. Note that it doesn't happen every single time with this, but often enough to easily reproduce it:

```lua
require("vim._extui").enable({})
vim.cmd.colorscheme("catppuccin")
```

The colorscheme used is this one: https://github.com/seblyng/dotfiles/blob/master/nvim/colors/catppuccin.lua

You can notice since the colors are different from the default ones, the default ones are first applied and show for a split second, before the colorscheme I set overrides them. This was not the case previously.

### Expected behavior

I would expect it to not show the startup screen and "flicker"

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-691+gf1f106be3d

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macOS

### Terminal name/version

Ghostty 1.1.3

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-ghostty

### Installation

build from source
title: startup: regression clearing initial screen with extui enabled
